title: Mesic-wet Calamagrostis
name: mesic-wet Calamagrostis
rationale: LightGBM provided the best quantitative performance.
description: The mesic-wet Calamagrostis diagnostic species set consists of species in the genus Calamagrostis that typically grow in mesic to wet soil conditions: Calamagrostis canadensis (Michx.) P. Beauv.; Calamagrostis inexpansa A. Gray; and Calamagrostis neglecta (Ehrh.) G. Gaertn., B. Mey. & Scherb. As a set, these species are common and widespread throughout the map domain, except in the Arctic Northern vegetation region. Of the constituent species, Calamagrostis canadensis is the most widespread and the most frequently dominant or co-dominant. While the other two species are primarily boreal and Arctic, Calamagrostis canadensis is common in the temperate bioclimatic zone as well. This diagnostic species set is especially important in the southern half of the map domain and in recently burned areas in the boreal bioclimatic zone.
